benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to payment

covered: PUT Method - Valid Request: Successful updates with required headers (TC01) and with optional headers (TC02); creation when no existing custom fields (TC03); removal/no-op with empty array (TC04).
PUT Method - Error Handling: Invalid paymentId format (TC05); payment not found (TC06); missing required header (TC07); missing body (TC08); malformed JSON (TC09); invalid CustomField data (TC10).
PUT Method - Authorization & Security: Unauthorized access (TC11); injection attempt in custom field value (TC13).
PUT Method - Server & Validation Coverage: Server error (TC12).
Edge Cases & Validation: Large number of custom fields (TC14); maximum length values (TC15); extra unexpected properties (TC16).
Integration & Data Consistency: Data verification via subsequent GET after update (TC17).
Regression & Duplicates: Duplicate custom field names handling (TC18).
Performance & Load: Concurrent requests (TC19); large payload size (TC20).
gaps: Partial Update semantics: PUT is treated as full update; explicit tests to verify rejection or acceptance of partial updates are not present.
403 Forbidden scenario: Only 401 Unauthorized is tested; no 403 coverage for insufficient permissions.
Rate limiting: No tests for throttling or rate limiting under bursty load.
Caching behavior: No tests verifying caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) for PUT responses.
Explicit concurrency conflict handling: No dedicated 409 tests for concurrent updates on the same resource.
recommendations: Add a 403 Forbidden test to cover insufficient permissions beyond 401.
Add rate-limiting tests to validate throttling behavior under bursts.
Add caching tests to verify ETag/Cache-Control headers on PUT responses.
Add explicit Partial Update tests to confirm whether partial updates are rejected or allowed (depending on API design).
Add concurrency-conflict tests (e.g., 409) when multiple clients update the same payment simultaneously.
Add tests for invalid header values (e.g., malformed X-Killbill-CreatedBy or X-Killbill-Reason) to improve header validation coverage.
